page.title: 06Folly Farm, Dunmow
page.content: Folly farm is a small arable farm just outside Dunmow near the A120 Bypass. It is farmed by Mr B Tamlyn, who is a tenant farmer and 2 helpers, Mr Mead and Mr Tamlyn's son. Folly Farm has 243 acres of arable land which is divided into 70 acres of winter wheat, 70 acres of winter barley, 24 acres of sugar beet, 17 acres of peas and 20 acres of spring barley. The farm is drained naturally by a stream but clay pipes are needed under each field to help improve drainage, so that the soil does not get water-logged. The farmhouse used to be an old granary barn, but it has now been converted into a house. There are five outside buildings - an old storage barn, a grain barn, a new workshop, a machines barn and an old workshop.
